title: Ukrainians Recount Frantic Russian Retreat
description: Residents of towns recently retaken by Ukraine described a chaotic flight by disorganized Russian troops, suggesting morale and inexperience remain major problems for Russia.

title: U.S. Rebukes Russia for Claims of Secret Bioweapons in Ukraine
description: Russia used a formal meeting in Geneva to air its unsupported accusations but faced considerable diplomatic pushback.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing: Putin and Xi Prepare to Meet
description: Plus a kangaroo killed a man in Australia and “Squid Game” made history at the Emmy Awards.

title: Clashes Erupt Between Armenia and Azerbaijan in Nagorno-Karabakh
description: The simmering conflict over the disputed Nagorno-Karabakh region last flared in 2020, when Russia brokered a cease-fire.

title: Russia Secretly Gave $300 Million to Political Parties and Officials Worldwide, U.S. Says
description: A U.S. intelligence review found Russian agencies and figures aimed to exert political influence abroad and sway elections on behalf of the Kremlin.

title: Armenia and Azerbaijan Clash Raises Fears of Broader Conflict
description: The long-simmering conflict last flared in 2020, when Moscow brokered a cease-fire. Now some wonder what Russia might do next.

title: In Northern Ireland, Mourning, Yes, but Symbolism, Too
description: King Charles III visited Belfast and met with members of Sinn Fein, the Irish nationalist party, now the largest in the country.

title: How the New Climate Law Can Save You Thousands of Dollars
description: Rebates and tax credits can lower the cost of solar panels, energy-efficient appliances and electric vehicles.

title: The U.S. Touts Big Investments for Mexico, Testing Its Nationalist Policies
description: U.S. officials are looking south for a strategic partner to create a regional manufacturing hub that can rival China. But there are still doubts over Mexico’s willingness to cater to foreign industry.

title: Putin Spokesman Says Russia Is Not Considering a New Draft
description: Russian commentators have been calling on President Vladimir V. Putin to bolster the army with recruits and to target Ukrainian infrastructure.

title: When the Queen Died, Someone Had to Tell the Bees
description: A report that the royal beekeeper had informed Queen Elizabeth II’s bees of her death received some mockery, but it has been a tradition for centuries.

title: How the Passage of Time Softened the Fury Over Diana’s Death
description: A quarter-century ago Princess Diana’s shocking death provoked outrage at the royal family. Queen Elizabeth’s passing, in contrast, has been draped in civility and respect.

title: Emmy Success for ‘Squid Game’ Is Hailed in South Korea
description: After the dystopian Netflix drama picked up multiple wins, Koreans celebrated the awards as the latest example of their country’s rise as a cultural powerhouse.

title: Challenges for Russia and China Test a ‘No-Limits’ Friendship
description: Vladimir Putin and Xi Jinping are set to meet later this week. Russia’s battlefield losses and China’s slowdown could complicate their relationship.

title: Fatal Kangaroo Attack Is Said to Be First in Australia in 86 Years
description: The police said they believed that the man had been keeping the wild animal as a pet.

title: Live Updates: Ukraine Replenishes Supplies With Russian Equipment
description: Russian forces have left behind a large amount of hardware as they retreat. Ukraine is investigating possible war crimes in a recently liberated village.

title: Sri Lanka Wins Cricket’s T20 Asia Cup, Bringing Joy to Fans
description: The men’s cricket team won the Asia Cup in the T20 format, hours after Sri Lanka won the equivalent championship in women’s netball. Both teams were feted with a parade on Tuesday.

title: Clashes Erupt Between Armenia and Azerbaijan in Nagorno-Karabakh
description: The simmering conflict between Armenia and Azerbaijan over the disputed region last flared in 2020, when Russia brokered a cease-fire.

title: Ukraine on the March
description: It’s not just one region. Ukraine is making progress in multiple places.

title: The Critical Moment Behind Ukraine’s Rapid Advance
description: President Volodymyr Zelensky wanted to make a dramatic move in the war against Russia. U.S. and Ukrainian officials came up with a plan.

title: Xi’s China and Biden’s U.S.: It Feels Like a Cold War
description: Even at their worst moments, the Americans and the Soviets kept talking. Today, U.S.-China contacts are scarce, while Beijing and Moscow move closer together.

title: Key Moments in the Russia-Ukraine War: A Timeline
description: Here is one key battlefield development from every month of the war.

title: Key Moments in the Russia-Ukraine War: A Timeline
description: Here is one key battlefield development from every month of the war.

title: Charles to Visit Northern Ireland Before Queen’s Coffin Arrives in London
description: The new monarch will continue his tour of the nations of the United Kingdom on Tuesday, before meeting his mother’s coffin at Buckingham Palace.

title: Kenya to Inaugurate William Ruto as President, but Kenyan Television Is Mostly Shut Out
description: After a bitter and close election, William Ruto takes the reins of power on Tuesday. One of his team’s first moves: Limiting the access of local television outlets to the ceremony.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: More Ukrainian advances.

title: King Charles Inherits Riches, and Passes Off His Own Empire
description: As prince, Charles used tax breaks, offshore accounts and canny real estate investments to turn a sleepy estate into a billion-dollar business.
